tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE water_quality_levels (
  region_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  region_name VARCHAR(50),
  water_quality_index INT,
  pollution_level DECIMAL(10, 2)
)

CREATE TABLE WaterQualityRegions (
  region_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  region_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  water_quality_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE PollutionSources (
  source_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  source_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  source_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  region_id INT REFERENCES WaterQualityRegions(region_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
)

CREATE TABLE WaterQualityReadings (
  reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  water_quality_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
  reading_date DATE NOT NULL,
  region_id INT REFERENCES WaterQualityRegions(region_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
)

CREATE TABLE WaterTests(
  test_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  source_id INT,
  quality_id INT,
  test_date DATE,
  test_result VARCHAR(50),
  FOREIGN KEY (source_id) REFERENCES WaterSources(source_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (quality_id) REFERENCES WaterQualityLevels(quality_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterSource (
    source_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    source_location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    region_id INT NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (region_id) REFERENCES Region(region_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterQuality (
    quality_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    quality_level INT NOT NULL,
    source_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (source_id) REFERENCES WaterSource(source_id)
);

CREATE TABLE PollutionData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    pollution_type VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    pollution_level INT NOT NULL,
    source_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (source_id) REFERENCES WaterSource(source_id)
);
